contest-event.event-date: Oct. 24, 1959 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Le Roi d'Ys Royal Albert Hall, Kensington, Kensington and Chelsea, Greater London, England, UK Prizes: 1st: 200 Guineas 2nd: 150 Guineas 3rd: 75 Guineas 4th: 50 Guineas The Baton of Honour was given to Eric Ball. Henry Geehl originally listed as adjudicator, but we've had reports that he produced no remarks, and it would seem odd to have four adjudicators. We've also been told that Crossley's Carpets came 6th with 183 points, rather than the fifth that we have listed. This comes from someone with remarks from the contest. Dec. 7, 2010, 10:22 a.m. April 5, 2020, 11:07 a.m. 1 Black Dyke Band George Willcocks 2 Carlton Main Frickley Colliery Band Jack Atherton 3 Fodens Band Rex Mortimer 4 The GUS Band Stanley Boddington 5 Crossley's Carpet Works John Harrison 6 Fairey Band Leonard Lamb Unknown Result Crookhall Colliery J.
